column4: After Tesla deal  Shanghai to speed up cancellation of foreign ownership limits
column5: SHANGHAI Shanghai will accelerate efforts to cancel restrictions on foreign investment in the auto manufacturing sector  a government official said on Wednesday  a day after Tesla  said it would build a wholly owned auto plant in the city.

column4: PRESS DIGEST-New York Times business news - July 11
column5: July 11 The following are the top stories on the New York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: Tesla goes big in China with Shanghai plant
column5: SHANGHAI Tesla Inc  Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk on Tuesday landed a deal with Chinese authorities to build a new auto plant in Shanghai  its first factory outside the United States  that would double the size of the electric car maker's global manufacturing. | Video

column4: AT&T to sell Magic Leap's augmented reality gadget in U.S.
column5: AT&T Inc has partnered with Magic Leap Inc  a secretive augmented reality startup backed by tech giants Google and Alibaba  to exclusively sell its wireless gadgets in the United States  the telecom company said on Wednesday.
